column1: '''Mika Milovana''' was the princess of [[Dale]] in the [[The Hobbit (1966 film)
Princess Mika Milovana was one of three who survived the destruction of [[Dale]] by the dragon [[Smaug
column2: Slag]], the others being a watchman and [[Thorin

column1: The Princess got angry when [[Bilbo Baggins
column2: Bilbo]] refused to accept his prophesied role of the dragon slayer and declared that she would go alone to the [[Lonely Mountain]]. Dismayed that a child should enter into such peril, Bilbo agreed to go.<ref name="video"/>

column1: After Bilbo had killed Slag, Dale was restored. Bilbo and Mika reigned there together for a time before they returned to [[Hobbiton]].<ref name="video"/>
According to [[Gene Deitch]], the director of [[The Hobbit (1966 film)
column2: ''The Hobbit'' (1966 film)]], the Princess was named after [[Wikipedia:Pete Seeger
column4: Mika]]". Her second name, "Milovana", 'means a beloved woman' in [[Wikipedia:Czech language
